academics.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

experience.description: Working on Quantum Managed Services, a set of services which allows Quantum support to monitor and repair on-premise appliances remotely. Also created many automated cost analysis tools.
Helping to lead two lab sections where I assist the teachers and answer student questions. Also leading office hour sections where I help students with their projects.
Extended the data pipeline to allow for distributed analysis of the data, and upgraded the data visualizer to allow viewing from the cloud

projects.title: 3D Renderer in SystemVerilog on an FPGA
projects.description: Designed and developed a GPU on a CycloneIV FPGA capable of arbitrary texured 3D rendering, and used it within an Avalon SOC along with the Intel NIOS II processor to build a sample of the game Minecraft.

projects.title: Ocarina of Time Randomizer
projects.description: Contributing to an Open Source project 'Ocarina of Time Randomizer', a rom hack played by thousands. My work consists of researching the functionality of the base game, then writing code injects my assembly code into the base game to add new features and options for players to enjoy.

projects.title: IOT SmartHub
projects.description: Created a device built around an ESP32 which could gather data from sensors and turn on and off connected devices based on user inputed thresholds. Live sensor data was visualized on a web portal using Grafana

projects.title: FRC FIRST Robotics
projects.description: Led a team of students as Programming Lead to program an FRC robot, which qualified for the world championships. Worked on PID, computer vision, distributed computing, and motion profiling.
